Uhlířský Hill near Bruntál – top part of a stratovolcano consisting of pyroclastic sediments
Photo by P. Rozsíval

Uhlířský Hill – the finest laid bare profiles by volcanic effusive (pyroclastic sediments on abandoned quarry walls situated on the slope of the volcano
Photo by P. Rozsíval
Uhlířský Hill – detail of layered pyroclastic sediments. Visible arrangement of bombs and small bombs caved into volcanic ash in the profile.
